web-app.description: The Java Data Management System is an open data collection management framework that enables a data provider or a community of users to upload, organize, manage and share large data holdings. It is designed to run in a wide array of contexts, ranging from local desktop use to real time and case-study data archives. Its HTML interface provides end-user support for configuration, browsing, search, creation, update and management of the data repository. A Java library and web-service api supports integration with external data management systems (e.g., LDM), data provision services (e.g., ADDE, TDS) and end-user clients (e.g., IDV). The Java Data Management System incorporates a number of rich information management facilities, including an extensible metadata framework, grouping, tagging, annotations, and associations. Based on an extensible Model-View-Control (MVC) framework, the data management system offers the ability to plug-in a variety of ways to access and deliver information - e.g., THREDDS catalogs, RSS feeds, and real-time event notification.
